page.title: 09CERI RICHARDS OF DUNVANT.
page.content: Born in Dunvant of Welsh-speaking parents,Ceri Richards was influenced greatly by his father's love of music and poetry.An accomplished pianist and organist,music was to inspire his art work later in life as did the scenery of his native Gower.Leaving school in 1919,he was apprenticed to a local firm but in 1921 he embarked on an art career.A student at Swansea School of Art,he won a scholarship to the Royal College of Art,later taking up work in commercial art followed by a teaching post at Chelsea College of Art.In 1960 he was awarded a C.B.E. which was followed by other honours bestowed on him by the University of Wales and the Royal College of Art.A permanent display of his work is to be seen at the Glynn Vivian Art Gallery in Swansea.
